intro: Centaurea intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Centaurea intermedia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, wastelands, and along roadsides.
